question: [File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Reconfiguration safety] Does the test verify that validator set changes during reconfig1 and reconfig2 (lines 136-166) maintain BFT safety with <1/3 Byzantine validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Trusted state transition] Can TrustedStateChange verification (lines 206-209, 322-325) be bypassed to accept invalid epoch changes, potentially causing network partition? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Genesis block race] Can race conditions in epoch2_genesis_id and epoch3_genesis_id computation (lines 201, 318) lead to validators using different genesis blocks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Version consistency] Does the test verify that version numbers increment correctly across epochs (lines 213, 329, 353), or could version gaps cause state inconsistencies? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Commit atomicity] Can executor.commit_blocks (lines 202, 319, 344) fail partially, leaving the database in an inconsistent state with some blocks committed and others not? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Block ID collision] Does the test verify that gen_block_id produces unique IDs, or could hash collisions allow different blocks to have the same ID causing consensus confusion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Parent block validation] Does execute_block properly validate parent_block_id (line 196), or can attackers create blocks with invalid parents to fork the chain? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Block finality bypass] Can blocks be uncommitted or reverted after commit_blocks succeeds, potentially violating finality guarantees? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Output state root] Does the test validate that output1, output2, output3 state roots (lines 188, 305, 331) match committed state, or could divergence cause validator disagreement? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: create_db_and_executor()] [Database initialization] Can force_sharding parameter (line 400) be exploited to create databases with inconsistent sharding configurations causing state corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: create_db_and_executor()] [Genesis bootstrap bypass] Does bootstrap_genesis properly initialize all required state, or could missing initialization allow unauthorized operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [State view version] Can attackers query state at arbitrary versions (line 261) to access pruned or unauthorized state, bypassing access controls? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Verified vs unverified state] Does the test properly distinguish verified_state_view (line 269) from state_view (line 261), or could unverified views return manipulated data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Transaction proof verification] Does get_transaction_by_version (lines 215-256) properly verify Merkle proofs, or can forged proofs return invalid transactions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Event verification gap] The test requests events for specific transactions (line 241) - can attackers forge events that don't match actual state changes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: verify_committed_txn_status()] [Proof verification bypass] Does proof.verify (line 465) check all proof elements, or can partial proof validation allow invalid transactions to appear committed? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Transaction list proof] Can get_transactions (lines 284-287, 382-385) return transactions that differ from committed blocks, causing validator state divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: gen_auxiliary_info_for_block()] [Auxiliary info manipulation] Can attackers manipulate proposer_index in EphemeralAuxiliaryInfo (line 488) to bypass proposer rotation or reputation tracking? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: gen_auxiliary_info_for_block()] [Auxiliary info missing] Does the test verify behavior when AuxiliaryInfo is missing or malformed, or could this cause transaction execution failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Block metadata timestamp] Can BlockMetadata timestamp (line 102) be manipulated to exploit time-dependent smart contracts or consensus timing assumptions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Failed votes handling] The failed_proposer_indices (lines 100, 160, 176) is empty - does production code properly handle failed proposals that could stall consensus? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Sequence number tracking] Does the test verify that core_resources_account sequence numbers increment correctly after each transaction, or could sequence number reuse enable replay attacks? [File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Account sequence initialization] Is account1, account2, account3 sequence number tracking (lines 82-85) properly initialized at 0, or could non-zero initialization cause replay vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-test-helpers/src/integration_test_impl.rs] [Function: test_execution_with_storage_impl_inner()] [Cross-epoch replay] Can transactions from epoch 1 be replayed in epoch 2 or 3 if sequence numbers reset during reconfigurations? (High)
